levels.level_2: use of automation. SMA conducts more frequent review and modification to program policy. Timeliness exceeds legal requirements. Maintain Program Policy
levels.level_3: and federal collaboration, use of information sharing, standards, and regional information exchange hubs. SMA develops, modifies, tracks, and report on program policy in less time than at Level 2.
levels.level_4: time. Processes that use clinical information result in immediate action, response, and results. SMA has interstate interoperability, which further improves timeliness over Level 3.
levels.level_5: time. Processes improve further through connectivity with other States and with federal agencies. Most processes execute at the point of service. Results are almost immediate.
